solution.text:
The zero of \(x-_{m}_\,\) is \(_{m}_\)
Substituting zero of \(g(x)\,\) in \(p(x)\,\), we get,
\(p(_{m}_)=(_{j}_ \times _{m}_^2) + (_{k}_ \times _{m}_) - _{l}_\)
\(\Rightarrow p(_{m}_)=_{{j*m*m}}_+_{{k*m}}_ - _{l}_\)
\(\Rightarrow p(_{m}_)=_{{j*m*m+k*m - l}}_\)
Therefore, the remainder when \(p(x)\) is divided by \(g(x)\) is \(_{{j*m*m+k*m - l}}_\)
